importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when the news about Joe Biden completing radiation therapy was published, indicating the most recent update on his treatment progress.
The date when Biden's personal office confirmed the diagnosis of an aggressive form of prostate cancer that had spread to his bones.
The date when Biden began a pill regimen as part of his prostate cancer treatment, showing an early phase of intervention.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time period during which Biden underwent treatment, including the initiation of pill therapy and the completion of radiation therapy.
The period following his diagnosis, during which he began and completed key cancer treatments, reflecting a timeline of medical management.

keyTakeAways: Former President Joe Biden has completed a course of radiation therapy for prostate cancer, following a diagnosis of an aggressive form that had spread to his bones.
He began a pill regimen earlier in the year and previously underwent Mohs surgery for skin cancer.
Biden's daughter Ashley shared a video and photo celebrating the completion of radiation therapy, expressing gratitude to medical staff at Penn Medicine Radiation Oncology.
Biden remains hopeful about his prognosis, stating that the cancer has not penetrated vital organs and that he feels good.
The completion of radiation therapy marks a significant milestone in his treatment journey, though future steps are still unclear.
Biden is scheduled to speak at events in Boston and Omaha, indicating that he is active in public life despite his illness.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former President Joe Biden has completed a course of radiation therapy for an aggressive form of prostate cancer that had spread to his bones. He began a pill regimen earlier this year and previously underwent Mohs surgery for skin cancer. The treatment milestone was celebrated by his daughter Ashley, who posted a video and photo thanking the medical staff at Penn Medicine Radiation Oncology in Philadelphia. Biden expressed confidence in his ability to overcome the illness, noting that the cancer has not penetrated vital organs. While future treatment steps remain unclear, Biden is expected to continue public appearances, including a speech at the Edward M. Kennedy Institute and an event for the Nebraska Democratic Party, underscoring his resilience and ongoing engagement in public life.
title: Biden completes a course of radiation therapy for cancer treatment
